title: Romantic Rose Day unlock website with 3 questions, hidden admin answers, and rose-petal animations

requirements.text: Replace the current frontend experience with a new, standalone, mobile-first Rose Day interactive website flow consisting of: (1) Lock screen intro, (2) 3-step typed-question unlock flow, (3) Rose Day reveal page, plus an optional hidden admin/owner view.

quotes: Create a romantic and flirty Rose Day interactive website that opens only after answering 3 questions.

acceptanceCriteria: On first load, the user sees the Rose Day lock screen (not the existing Valentine/proposal multi-section home).
The Rose Day flow is usable on mobile screens (e.g., 360px width) without horizontal scrolling.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the mandatory Question Section as a 3-step wizard showing one question at a time with a typing input field, requiring a non-empty typed answer before the user can proceed to the next question.

requirements.text: Persist the three typed answers and submit them to the backend as a single submission when the user completes Question 3, then transition to the Rose Day reveal page only after a successful submission.

quotes:
Answer Visibility (Very Important):
Store and display all typed answers in a hidden owner/admin section or submission summary panel so that I (the creator) can see exactly what answers she typed.

acceptanceCriteria: On completing Q3, the frontend calls a backend method that stores Q1/Q2/Q3 answers together in one record.
If the backend call fails, the user remains on the last step and sees a clear, English error message with an option to retry submission.
After successful submission, the user is transitioned to the reveal page with a smooth animation.

requirements.text: Add Motoko backend storage and APIs to record and retrieve submissions containing all three answers exactly as typed, so the creator can review what was entered later.

quotes: Store and display all typed answers in a hidden owner/admin section or submission summary panel so that I (the creator) can see exactly what answers she typed.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update method to create a submission containing q1, q2, q3 and a created-at timestamp.
Backend exposes a query method to list stored submissions (including the exact q1/q2/q3 text values).
Stored submissions persist across page refreshes and canister restarts/upgrades via stable storage.
No additional backend canisters/services are introduced (single-actor only).

requirements.text: Implement a hidden owner/admin section in the frontend that allows the creator to view a submissions list (including the exact answers typed for Q1/Q2/Q3) fetched from the backend.

quotes: Store and display all typed answers in a hidden owner/admin section or submission summary panel so that I (the creator) can see exactly what answers she typed.

acceptanceCriteria: There is a discoverable-but-hidden way to open the admin view (e.g., a URL toggle like a query param or hash).
The admin view displays a list of submissions with the three answers shown verbatim (no masking or truncation by default).
The admin view is not shown during the normal lock ‚Üí questions ‚Üí reveal experience unless explicitly opened.

requirements.text: Apply a rose-themed visual design using soft red, pink, and white, with smooth transitions and a floating rose petals animation overlay that feels elegant and not distracting.

quotes:
The website should be mobile-first, elegant, and emotional with rose-themed design.
Use soft red, pink, and white colors, floating rose petals animation, and smooth transitions.

acceptanceCriteria: A rose-petal floating animation is visible on the main user flow screens (lock, questions, reveal) and does not block interactions (pointer-events disabled).
Colors and styling match a soft red/pink/white premium Valentine-style feel (no harsh/neon palette).
Transitions between lock/questions/reveal are smooth (e.g., fade/slide), consistent, and performant on mobile.

requirements.text: Include optional romantic background music controlled by a user-initiated toggle (no autoplay) and ensure the site remains fully functional if the audio asset is missing.

quotes: Use smooth scrolling, romantic music (optional), and a premium Valentine-style feel.

acceptanceCriteria: Music playback starts only after a user gesture (tap/click).
If the configured audio file is not available, the music control does not break the rest of the UI.
Music can be toggled on/off during the experience.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Frontend must be React + TypeScript with Tailwind and existing shadcn/ui components composed (do not edit read-only UI component sources under frontend/src/components/ui).
Do not edit files listed in frontend.immutablePaths (e.g., useActor/useInternetIdentity/main.tsx).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Do not implement third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is available; not required for this request).
Do not add real-time features (no WebSockets/live updates).
Do not add external databases or external storage services.
Do not build a multi-page URL router unless necessary; keep navigation simple and app-internal.
